name: BEST WESTERN Beachside Inn

reviews.title: Must be better choices out there.
reviews.text: We picked this due to it's proximity to train station -about 1/2 mile walk; and price - $107 plus taxes. After walking by the Oceana and West Beach Inn, we were deflated to see the industrial look of the BW. Our room -108 - was next to the pool gate, and the room not very sound proof. We were out late, so it didn't bother us, but if you keep early hours, beware.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool was about the smallest I've seen with negliglble landscaping.
reviews.title: Good bang for your Buck!
Along beach, pier and 10 min. walk to State St.
reviews.text: Room was tiny. No microwave, dvd, or fridge. Did have large flatscreen tv. Small-seeming queen bed was ok. Furnishings were strange! Some kind of tall empty consul held the coffee maker and the 2 chairs and table were aluminum and plastic patio style.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good water pressure in shower, but it leaked all over the floor, no matter how careful we were. Not pretty, but clean.
reviews.title: Beach view good room

likes.liked: — Close to beach and transit to tourist areas

reviews.text: Continental breakfast was better than a lot of places. Breads, bagels, sweet rolls, fruit and cold cereals -and a large bowl of hard boiled eggs!
reviews.title: Nice location, decent price
This place was awful!!!
reviews.text: We got in late on a Friday night and were given the room with the "Park View" sounds nice, right? WRONG! It was the noisiest room I have ever stayed in. It sounds like the traffic was going right through the room. The walls are so thin you can hear the people next door talking. The bed was not attached to the wall so if you sat on the end the part where the pillow are would just come off the floor.

reviews.title: Not worth the money!
reviews.text: Then I complained when I went to check out so the next night I was put in a "mini-suite". YUCK! First, it smelled like paint. Then you are right next to stairs and a vending machine- talk about noisy. Then in the morning all the water in the whole building turning on- well you can hear that. I have NEVER seen such dirty/ dingy carpets in my life in both rooms.

reviews.title: Last Resort
reviews.text: I think they should just flatten it and start over!

reviews.title: bad hotel stayed on aug. 4 2004
reviews.text: The bottom line, for $200 per night, this hotel does not meet, by any means, ones expectations. Not even the view of the Wharf, of which we did not have. We had the view of the park, where come Sunday morning at 6:30 am, the Food Bank begins serving breakfast to those in need....or for those who spent the night in the park. As stated before, even the view of the wharf....doesn't matter you'll leave feeling resentful and wishing you had spent the money next door at the Oceana or West Beach Inn. Unfortuneately, Santa Barbara is a supply and demand town - so my advise is to book your trip early and expect to pay from $250 to $300 per night for a hotel that at least represents the tranquility of Santa Barbara and or a jacuzzi.

reviews.title: This place is awful
reviews.text: It wasn't that we discounted the preceding comments here from other Tripadvisor reviewers or ignored the fact that there's a conspicuous lack of positive commentary about the Best Western Beachside anywhere we could find; our travel agenda simply permitted only one night in beautiful Santa Barbara, and the Beachside was the only place we could find that would accept a one night reservation on a summer Saturday. We figured this might be a telling sign and it was. The Beachside isn't to avoid altogether, just be advised and know what to expect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 229, a "mini suite". Upon entering this room, I was pleasantly surprised how clean and nice it looked. It was comprised of two very small rooms, both with large flat screen televisions, a ceiling fan in each room, the furinture & carpet seemed fairly new and clean. So in the room getting ready we start noticing that's it's warm in there so we try to turn on the air conditioning. There is a control on the wall (what it controls, I have no idea) and a device below that that appears as if it may function as an air conditioner, but apparently it's just for looks. So we try to turn up the ceiling fans, but they apparently have only one speed which is very low. We open all the windows to try to cool it off, but to no avail. I am not exaggerating when I say that it was about 10 degrees hotter in the room than it was outside, and honestly, if this was the only problem, I wouldn't have minded, but unfortunately that was only the tip of the iceberg.
reviews.title: worst night's sleep ever!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: After going out for the night, we came back to the room, which wasw swtill pretty warm and tried to sleep. I started to notice how very hard the mattress was, but figured once I fell asleep it wouldn't matter. Of course it was difficult to sleep since the windows were open and it was pretty loud outside with surrounding streets, guests shouting, oh, and don't forget the train station, which is apparently VERY close and they apparently have the requirement that every train that comes in to the station idles for approximately 5 minutes while tooting it's whistle the whole time!!!! So anyway, somehow we fall asleep and can live with the situation until around 12:30 in the mornining when the real fun began... Around that time my husband and I were JOLTED out of our beds by THE LOUDEST BANGING NOISE EVER! I can only assume that it was the water pipes in the wall, that is truly my best guess, but I really don't know. It sounded as if a car had hit the side of the building. THIS IS NOT AN EXAGGERATION. This noise continued to happen THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE NIGHT, I would say it occurred periodically, at least twice an hour, lasting for about 10 seconds or so each time. There is NO WAY any person with the gift of hearing could possible sleep through this.
reviews.title: Wow..Flat Screen TV and New Room !

likes.liked: — new rooms and flat screen tv in poolside rooms

reviews.text: Unfortunately, now that we were awake ( and I mean VERY awake because the sound is so loud and jarring that it truly scares the life out of you each time it happens) we are now VERY aware of how uncomfortable the bed is. It was to the point that my husband finally got up and opened up the sleeper sofa in the other room and we slept on that, AND IT WASN'T A COMFORTABLE SLEEPER SOFA, but it was better than the bed. Of course the train is still tooting, it's still very hot in there and there is still traffic & people noise.... but truly the WORST thing was the jarring noise of the water pipes or whatever it was that kept happening throughout the night until approximately 5:30 a.m..
reviews.title: Decent place, decent price
A bit disappointed
reviews.text: I promise you that it was the longest night of my life, and I spent most of it laying there praying that time would go by faster & thinking of what I would write on this site. I honestly considered going out to my car to sleep, but frankly it didn't seem too safe, and I'm pregnant, so it really didn't seem like a good idea. I kept PRAYING for it to be 5:00 so it would be a somewhat reasonable time to get up & leave. We did not complain in the middle of the night because we felt like what difference would it make, we'd just be put in another hot room with an uncomfortable bed & kept hoping we would fall asleep.

reviews.title: Volleyball AVP Heaven
reviews.text: When we complained in the morning they could not have cared less! They acted as if they had no idea in what we were talking about with the noise, which I find VERY hard to believe that no one has ever complained about that noise before ( we even spoke to the people in the room next to us who heard the sound all night too) and the clerk actually asked us if it was the water pipes or the air conditioning pipes! (a) like I know and (b) WHAT AIR CONDITIONING?!?!?! Is that a joke? We were offered no apologies or courtesies... the most we got was the manager's business card so we could call & talk to her ( because of course she wasn't there). And the real insult to injury is that we paid $216 to stay in this dump and a few nights later we spent approximately the same amount to stay in a beautiful place with anything your heart desires included.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I booked this hotel, I checked the reviews here on Tripadvisor. One user noted that he was ultimately disappointed with the look and feel of Beachside Inn after passing by more aesthetically pleasing neighboring hotels such as Oceana and Habor View Inn. This user certainly hit the nail on the head!
reviews.title: Drab Hotel, but Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Compared to its neighboring hotels, Beachside Inn was dark, gloomy, and had a low quality motel feel to it. It wouldn't be so bad if I paid less than $100 per night, but for a two night stay, I paid almost $400, which included the typical add-on fees.
reviews.title: Bathroom needed face lift

reviews.text: There was nothing impressive about our room. The bathroom had a small standing shower that had no place to put your shampoo/conditioner. There were glass cups provided on the nightstand, which were dirty. I thought there was free wi-fi but I guess they were talking about the tiny outdated computer in the lobby. The front desk was definitely NOT friendly or approachable. The continental breakfast was your typical bagels, cream cheese, bread, PB&J, fruit, cereal, coffee variety, which was just fine. Having breakfast was one of the few Pro's of this place.
reviews.title: Good Value!

reviews.text: The only other Pro's would be the location. It was only a few blocks from Stearns Wharf and State Street. But like I said, the neighboring hotels appeared to be much nicer, including Harbor View Inn, which a couple we met bragged was an amazing hotel.
reviews.title: Not If You Need Your Sleep...

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in April. The room was located near a hallway, near the elevator and stairs. So it got quite noisy at times. The room was nice as it looked like it had been remodeled, except for the bathroom. It looked like they tried to remodel it, but it just didn't happen. There were attempts at chaulking all over and it was coming off the sink and other areas. The bathroom smelled like mold and mildew and occasionally there was a strong smell too. I don't know if we were close to the maids room. The drawer on the vanity didn't come out, so you only had one drawer to use and it didn't smell that great either.
reviews.title: Ok...not great.

aka: Best Western Beachside Hotel Santa Barbara
description: Welcome to the Beachside Inn, perfectly located just across the street and a few minutes walking distance from the harbor, pier and beaches of Santa Barbara. From our fantastic location, you can also enjoy a beautiful walk to "downtown" Santa Barbara, and experience all our world class dining and shopping. And to make life even easier, the Santa Barbara beachfront/downtown electric shuttle is available at our front door if you're planning to have an even more relaxing day while visiting. Our 60 room hotel will be sure to offer you the quaint charm, which represents Santa Barbara's essence. But we also offer some of the most modern conveniences. From our very hi-speed internet, to a fabulous continental breakfast and the latest in air conditioning / heating systems, we are all confident you will have a memorable visit here in Santa Barbara all handled by our fabulous staff.We look forward to welcoming all of you to our wonderful littleescape by the sea in beautiful Santa Barbara.
